DOC.brief_summary: This study test whether Continuous Glucose Monitor pickup difference glucose ( interstitial fluid ) dietary intervention use meal either high low glycemic load .
DOC.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring During Diets That Differ Glycemic Load
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine suitability continuous glucose monitor detect impact dietary intervention postprandial blood glucose level normal , healthy , free living subject . We compare dietary intervention meal high glycemic load ( high post-meal blood glucose ) versus meal low glycemic load ( low post-meal blood glucose ) cross-over study . In addition , glucose profile obtain via venous blood sample via continuous glucose monitor follow standard carbohydrate load compare .
DOC.criteria: Apparently healthy male postmenopausal female Age start study ≥ 50 ≤ 70 year Body mass index ( BMI ) ≥ 25.0 ≤ 35.0 kg/m2 Fasting blood glucose value subject ≥ 3.4 < 6.1 mmol/L screen Being use eat three meal day Having general practitioner Agreeing inform medically relevant personal testresults physician Accessible vein arm determine examination screening . Having medical condition might affect study measurement ( include limit : diabetes type 1 type 2 , gastrointestinal disorder , gastrointestinal surgery inflammatory disease , judge study physician Reported use overthecounter prescribe medication food supplement , may interfere study measurement judge principal investigator Use oral antibiotic 40 day less prior start study Reported participation another nutritional biomedical study 3 month screen study Reported participation night shift work 2 week prior screen study . Night work define work midnight 6.00 Reported intense sporting activity > 2h/w . Intense sport activity define activity cause lack breath limit ability normal conversation Reported alcohol consumption > 10 units/week ( female ) > 14 units/week ( male ) Reported use nicotine containing product 6 month precede study willing abstain use nicotine containing product study Reported dietary habit : medically prescribe diet , slimming diet , vegetarian Reported weight loss/gain ( > 3 kg ) last 2 month study Being employee Unilever research department NUTRIM Maastricht University Medical Centre ( MUMC+ ) collaborate study Known allergy intolerance food product . Blood donation past 3 month
